roleset.name: manner of motion
roleset.note: CREEP-V NOTES: Based on sentences in wsj. Member of VNcls run-51.3.2, modes_of_being_with_motion-47.3, swarm-47.5.1-1. (from creep.01-v)

roles.note: 'Up' is only one of many possible directions; expect to see also'higher' 'back' and others. (from creep.01-v)

example.name: creep up: not phrasal
example.text: Inventories are creeping up; car inventories are already high, and big auto makers are idling plants.

roleset.name: approach
roleset.note: CREEP_UP-V NOTES: See VNcls modes_of_being_with_motion-47.3, but verb particle construction is not member of VN. (from creep.02-v)

example.name: creep up: phrasal
example.text: In Mr. Sohmer's film, by contrast, we are urged to share the perverse excitement of the rapist creeping up on his victim, as the camera ogles Kate in various stages of undress and lingers on the sight of her trussed-up body during frequent flashbacks to the rape.

roleset.name: scare
roleset.note: CREEP_OUT-V NOTES: Based on Bolt SMS data. Comparison to scare.01. Scare.01 is a member of VN class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from creep.03-v)

example.name: args 0, 1, and 3
example.text: Little girls creep the hell out of me.

roleset.name: scary, unsettling
roleset.note: CREEPY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS, comparison to 'scare'. Relation to a currently unframed sense of 'creep-v'. (from creepy.01-j)

example.name: arg0
example.text: No -- I do n't have much worth taking . They broke a window though& went through all my stuff , which is totally creepy . Do you guys want to go to the farmer 's market ?
